channel.title: ai-news on Joachim Weise
channel.description: Recent content in ai-news on Joachim Weise

item.title: AI weekly (51/2019)
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Joachim Weise)
item.description: +++ Facebook has a neural network that can do advanced math +++ Google’s AI can identify wildlife from trap-camera footage with up to 98.6% accuracy +++ Intel acquires AI chip startup Habana Labs for $2 billion +++ eBay open-sources AI platform Krylov +++ AI experts urge machine learning researchers to tackle climate change +++

item.title: AI weekly (49/2019)
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Joachim Weise)
item.description: +++ An Epidemic of AI Misinformation +++ AWS launches SageMaker Studio, a web-based IDE for machine learning +++ Deep Learning For Symbolic Mathematics +++ Alibaba: Dynamic Pricing with Deep RL +++ Training multi-agent AI systems to solve complex tasks through cooperation +++ A Visual Guide to Using BERT for the First Time +++ Vaex: How to analyse 100 GB of data on your laptop with Python +++

item.title: AI weekly (48/2019)
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Joachim Weise)
item.description: +++ Introducing TF-GAN: A lightweight GAN library for TensorFlow 2.0 +++ Global AI Survey: AI proves its worth, but few scale impact +++

item.title: AI weekly (47/2019)
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Joachim Weise)
item.description: +++ AI will speed up the hunt for Nazca Lines in southern Peru +++ Increasing transparency with Google Cloud Explainable AI +++ RecSim: Configurable Simulation Platform for Recommender Systems +++ Safety Gym: Reinforcement Learning Agents That Respect Safety Constraints +++ Sony Accounces the Establishment of Sony AI +++

item.title: AI weekly (46/2019)
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Joachim Weise)
item.description: +++ Machine vision sees behind walls and in darkness +++ Deep Learning deciphers historical Japanese texts +++ Microsoft’s Vision AI Developer Kit is now generally available +++ Intel unleashes three new chips for AI work, challenging Nvidia +++ Looker seeks to go beyond business intelligence +++ Nasdaq is testing a deep learning system to monitor trading +++ Gaussian Processes, not quite for dummies +++ Self-training with Noisy Student improves ImageNet classification +++
